meanings.definition: Coming or happening later than should have been the case.
meanings.sent1: The belated train arrived after everyone had left the station.
meanings.sent2: Her belated apology was appreciated, even though it came late.
meanings.sent3: The belated birthday cake was a surprise, but better late than never!
meanings.sent4: The belated sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The belated snowfall covered the ground in a sparkling blanket.

meanings.sent1: The belated package finally arrived at the doorstep.
meanings.sent2: His belated response to the email caused some confusion.
meanings.sent3: The belated bus made everyone late for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The belated bloom of the flower surprised the gardeners.
meanings.sent5: The belated sunrise cast long shadows across the field.

meanings.definition: Late in relation to a specified time.
meanings.sent1: The belated arrival of the guests delayed the party.
meanings.sent2: Their belated departure meant they missed the beginning of the movie.
meanings.sent3: The belated alarm clock made him oversleep for the third time this week.
meanings.sent4: The belated train whistle echoed through the empty platform.
meanings.sent5: The belated harvest left the fields barren for weeks.
